alert.note: Alert for Lamar; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 12:07PM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Potato Creek at County Line Rd near Orchard Hill affecting Lamar and Spalding Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Potato Creek at County Line Rd near Orchard Hill. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding of woodlands...fields and pastures begin upstream and downstream from the gage on County Line Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:45 AM EST Tuesday was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.4 feet on 02/19/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1215 AM EST.
